intro: Sisymbrium texanum, commonly known as Texas tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by pods that release tiny seeds. The plant has a distinctive appearance with hairy stems and pinnately divided leaves.
